intro: Bridelia nayarii, commonly known as the red bridelia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered yellow flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and have a glossy appearance. Bridelia nayarii is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, thriving in moist, well-drained soils.
